instruction: Q: if a student wants an orange, he would have to get it from which of these? Answer choices: A: from a live cow, B: from a live plant, C: from a volcano cave, D: from a wild dog
label: B

instruction: Q: What could have covered an organism in order to create a trilobite? Answer choices: A: Grass, B: Water, C: Snow, D: Sand
label: D

instruction: Q: A dog is more likely to shiver at Answer choices: A: 1 pm, B: 5 am, C: 9 am, D: 6 pm
label: B

instruction: Q: Photosynthesis does what by converting carbon dioxide, water, and sunlight into carbohydrates? Answer choices: A: nourishes small protein bits that need to eat with tiny shakes, B: providing nourishment which enables some growth to vegetation, C: mixes carbs into soluble plant matter, D: makes good vegetable protein
label: B

instruction: Q: where might a bunny live? Answer choices: A: a thicket, B: atop palm trees, C: a sewer system, D: a deserted island
label: A

instruction: Q: A shark will be unable to survive on eating algae and moss, because Answer choices: A: it is a predator, B: it is a vegetarian, C: it is a freshwater fish, D: it is a producer
label: A

instruction: Q: A meadow vole just gave birth, and needs to feed herself so that she can produce milk for her babies. She searches for food in a field, and happily munches down on some Answer choices: A: oil, B: deer, C: bugs, D: recycled plastic fruit
label: C

instruction: Q: The Grand Canyon was formed by Answer choices: A: a volcano erupting in 1782, B: a river named after the 20th state to join the union flowing over time, C: a river named after the 38th state to join the union flowing over time, D: the Great Lakes drying up
label: C

instruction: Q: A woman, with a pale complexion, wants to spend the bright, sunny day at the beach. She makes sure that she stops at the store to pick up some sunblock before she begins to enjoy her day filled with sand and surf. She applies the sunblock carefully and thoroughly, because she knows that Answer choices: A: UV rays are harmful, B: sunlight will be fun, C: the sun is close, D: the sun is in space
label: A

instruction: Q: A person is heating water in order to cook pasta. He spills the pot of water on his leg and finds that the water Answer choices: A: scalds, B: cools, C: toasts, D: freezes
label: A

instruction: Q: Pasta may be cooked in water when Answer choices: A: the water is warm, B: the water is on the stove, C: water is bubbling from applied warmth, D: the pasta is very fresh
label: C

instruction: Q: A decrease in diseases Answer choices: A: has no impact on a population, B: leads to more sick people, C: leads to less sick people, D: leads to an uptick in emergency room visits
label: C

instruction: Q: When soil is viewed in a scientific way, what is seen and viewed is actually Answer choices: A: insects like big beetles, B: tiny lifeforms in dirt, C: small mammals living there, D: a lot of tiny pebbles
label: B

instruction: Q: Some animals use a liquid coming from their skin to adjust to Answer choices: A: cold, B: water, C: heat, D: humidity
label: C
